Hi Daniel,

I think that you will have to write code to do this. If you want to use 
1.12.1 out-of-box then you can do this with a beanshell processor which 
will limit your solutions.


If you decide to use beanshell processor, add it after the link scoper.
This processor can check all outlinks and if they are slash pages (e.g 
http://example.pt/ or http://example.pt:8080/), replaced them with new 
candidate URIs created as seeds with empty hop path and no via.
If they don't match a slash page pattern, then create slash pages as 
seeds (same as above) and add them to the outlinks ((e.g 
http://example.pt/dir/ yields http://example.pt/)).

It is not pretty but it should work.

Some methods and constructors that might help:

- CrawlURI getOutCandidates()
- CrawlURI replaceOutlinks()
- CandidateURI(UURI u, String pathFromSeed, UURI via, CharSequence 
viaContext)
- CandidateURI setIsSeed
- Simple beanshell script that would print all processed uris may look like:
----------------
import org.archive.crawler.datamodel.CrawlURI

process(CrawlURI curi) {
	System.out.println(curi.getCrawlURIString());
}
-----------


I hope this helps.

Take care
i.






> Hi everyone.
> 
> Portugal is now beginning its national web archiving initiative with 
> project Tomba at FCCN (National
> Foundation for Scientific Computing).
> 
> We are now beggining to use Heritirx 1.12.1 and we would appreciate some 
> hints on how to configure Heritrix for our purposes.
> 
> We would like to crawl:
> 
> - All the sites referenced by the seeds until a maximum number of 3 hops 
> in a breadth first fashion, including seeds from several domains plus,
> - All the sites hosted on the .PT domain newly found during the crawl, 
> (not part of the seeds), until a maximum number of 3 hops in a breadth 
> first fashion counting from the home page of the site. If the hops 
> counting would begin on a landing page different from the home page of 
> the new site it is also ok.
> 
> We tried to configure max-hops, max-trans-hops and max-speculative-hops 
> but this are all counted from the seeds.
> 
> Basically, we would like that the counting of hops would be reset 
> everytime we visit a new site, independently from it is a seed or not.
> 
> Could you please help us?
> 
> Best regards.
>
